title: Famous Palaces Quiz
description: Step inside the world's grandest palaces and test your knowledge of these magnificent royal residences.

questions.question: The Palace of Versailles, known for its Hall of Mirrors, is located near which European capital?
Buckingham Palace, the official London residence of the British monarch, has approximately how many rooms?
The Forbidden City, the world's largest palace complex, served as the imperial palace for which country's emperors?
The Winter Palace in St. Petersburg now houses which famous art museum?
Schönbrunn Palace, a 1,441-room former imperial summer residence, is located in which city?
The Potala Palace, the former winter residence of the Dalai Lama, is located in which city?
Neuschwanstein Castle, which inspired the Sleeping Beauty Castle at Disneyland, is located in which country?
The Royal Palace of Madrid is the official residence of the Spanish royal family. Is it still used as their home?
options: No, it is now a museum only
No, it is only used for state ceremonies

questions.question: Topkapi Palace, the primary residence of Ottoman sultans for nearly 400 years, is in which city?
The Grand Palace in Bangkok, Thailand, was built during the reign of which dynasty?
Mysore Palace, one of India's most visited monuments, is known for being illuminated with how many light bulbs?
The Palace of Westminster in London is better known as the home of which institution?
Peterhof Palace, known as the 'Russian Versailles,' is famous for its elaborate system of what?
Hampton Court Palace, famous for its maze garden, was a favorite residence of which English king?
The Château de Chambord, the largest château in the Loire Valley, is famous for its double-helix staircase possibly designed by whom?
